alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 22 at 5:25AM MST until August 23 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tucson AZ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River Near Gila River near Solomon affecting Graham County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Gila River Near Gila River near Solomon. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Agricultural flooding begins from Solomon down to Thatcher. Water begins to threaten bridge approaches in the Safford Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM MST Monday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 21.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.8 feet on 10/02/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 10 AM MST.
